document.topic_text: Charlie's Cafe in Norfolk burglarized again Surveillance Video Jemie Lee, WVEC 1:15 PM. EST April 25, 2016 According to police, the suspect broke into Charlie’s Café at 1800 Granby Street and then the Chick-fil-a at 1600 Monticello Ave. between 12 a.m. and 3 a.m. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST NORFOLK, Va. (WVEC) -- Norfolk Police are looking for a man who burglarized two Norfolk businesses early Monday morning. According to police, the suspect broke into Charlie’s Café at 1800 Granby Street and then the Chick-fil-a at 1600 Monticello Ave. between 12 a.m. and 3 a.m. In both cases, the man broke out the glass in front door and then stole cash. This is the third time in just over a year that someone broke into Charlie's Café . The owner, Ram Karaslaan, told 13News Now he is heartbroken, but will continue to press on. Anyone with information on the suspect should call the Crime Line at 1-888-LOCK-U-UP.
